headline: Small-cap records, chip stock gains, silver: Market Takeaways
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) close Thursday's session higher following AI optimism tied to the US trade deal with Taiwan. Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre breaks down the biggest market themes from today’s trading day, including how small-cap indexes are reaching record highs, stock movements in semiconductor chip manufacturers, and price trends in silver (SI=F). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Applied Materials, Lam Research and KLA Stocks Hit Record Highs
summary: Strong results from Taiwan's TSMC helped push U.S. semiconductor-equipment stocks to new peaks.    Shares in Applied Materials, KLA and Lam Research rose roughly 5% to 8% on Thursday morning.   All three stocks hit new intraday peaks, according to Dow Jones Market Data, and were among the best performers in the S&P 500.

headline: Chip Stocks Rally After TSMC Earnings Boost AI Boom Outlook
summary: Companies that provide picks and shovels for the artificial-intelligence boom jumped after record earnings from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. suggested that the AI rally still has room to run.  U.S.-listed shares of TSMC jumped 6% in premarket trading.  The world’s largest contract chip maker said it plans to increase capital expenditure this year to up to $56 billion, a sign that demand remains strong from clients such as Apple, Google and Nvidia.

headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: TSMC, Lam Research, Nvidia, Goldman, Morgan Stanley, BlackRock, and More
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing beats earnings expectations, sending its own shares and chip-manufacturing tool maker stocks higher.

headline: U.S. Tech Stocks Gain Ground Premarket After TSMC Results
summary: Record fourth-quarter revenue for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. gave a shot in the arm to U.S. artificial-intelligence stocks, as the sector rallied in Thursday's premarket. TSMC revenue surpassed both its own guidance and analysts' forecasts, and the results represent "a very positive outlook for the industry", ING analyst Marc Hesselink wrote.
